intro: Stryphnodendron cristalinae, commonly known as the crystal tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The tree is known for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical conditions and is often found in dense forest understories. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties. However, due to habitat loss, it faces threats of endangerment in its natural range.
